data.title: Horrible gyro
data.text: Ordered my big fat Greek gyro with grilled chicken. The chicken was taken straight out of the fridge. It was cold and mostly pink on the inside. The tahini sauce was horrible too. Worst gyro ever.

data.title: Pizza and Meatball Sub
data.text: Had cheese pizza and sub delivered to our hotel.  Ordered online, and it was easy and delivered to our room in about 20 minutes.  Sub was great- the meatballs were very good for a sub and pizza place.  The pizza was very much NY style.  I grew up on NY pizza and this is equivalent with any NY place.  Though, not necessarily outstanding, for delivery it was a great surprise.

data.title: This one stands out in a sea of pizza joints
data.text: Some of the tastiest NY style pizza in town. Friendly staff and good delivery service. I've ordered from here many times.

data.title: Only Good Pizza in Waltham; The Staff is Rude
data.text:
Such a struggle for me to add that third star!  I still can't believe I did it.  Here's the deal: the pizza here, in my estimation, is the best in the area, which pisses me off because I hate this place.  The staff always seems distracted and annoyed at your presence, as if patronizing the establishment at which they are employed somehow gets in the way of their good day.  They have no compunction about saying "what?" or yelling at you across the room to tell you your food's ready, or, for that matter, completely ignoring your presence.  And about the pizza, it's excellent thin-crust, Neapolitan style brick oven pizza--that is, if you happen to get there at the time that a fresh one is just coming out of the oven.  Otherwise, skip the slice and order a pie, because they let the slices sit out in a little warmer for hours.  Gross.

But if you don't mind feeling like an annoyance and perhaps getting it stale and burnt, you should at least try the pizza here.  As far as quality pizza goes, Waltham is certainly not a high contender in this department despite the horde of pizza places nearby (Anna's, Lena's, Sabatino's, Prospect Street, Upper Crust, Angelo's, etc. etc.).  It's so convenient that this place is on my street, but I only go if I must have pizza right now!  If you're in the mood for any other type of experience, go anywhere else.

data.title: Awesome specialty pizzas
data.text: I love the Chicken Alfredo pizza, it has pasta on the pizza= terrible for you, but so YUMMY. also buff chic pizza is awesome. great crust

data.title: Very Rude owners
data.text: I used to order from this place for my office, very large amounts for staff meetings of 100 etc.  They delivered the wrong  lunch order to us, then proceeded to scream at me (the customer) that it was my problem.   They switched our order with another office, the order was in the process of being eaten by our staff, when the owner stormed in and took no responsibility whatsoever for the mistake of her delivery man delivering to the wrong office.  No apology, no credits, no more ordering from NY Pizza.

data.title: Good meal when traveling alone.
data.text: Good quick service to my hotel. Eggplant Parm was great!

data.title: Best carry out pizza ever!
data.text: After an exhausting day touring great sites in Boston, my family was ready for TV and pizza. The hotel we stayed at advised us to order from NY Pizza. We ordered two large salads to share, which were crisp and fresh. We also had a huge cheese pizza, which was delicious. All very reasonably priced, too.
